result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcos R. ALFARO Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Obtain GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Provide DNA sample.
Expungement is ordered under Section 973.015 upon successful completion of the sentence.  The Court finds that the defendant will benefit and society will not be harmed by expungment in this matter.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Plea date on May 24, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 11-24-15 at 2:00 p.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with DA set for 10-20-2015 at 3:00 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of fleeing an officer.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
